short_description: This function clusters the users according to their Jaccard similarity measure.
long_description: This function clusters the users according to their Jaccard similarity measure.

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the input table.
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table.

input_tables.name: SeedTable
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the table that contains the seeds to use for hashing. Typically, this table was created by an earlier Minhash call that specified its name in the SaveSeedTo argument.
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table that contains the seeds to use for hashing. Typically, this table was created by an earlier ta.minhash call that specified its name in the save.seed.to argument.

output_tables.name: OutputTable
output_tables.description: Specifies the name of the output table.
output_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the output table.

output_tables.name: SaveSeedTo
output_tables.description: Specifies the name of the table where seeds are to be saved.
output_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table where seeds are to be saved.

argument_clauses.name: IdColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the values to be hashed into the same cluster. Typically these values are customer identifiers.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the values to be hashed into the same cluster. Typically these values are customer identifiers.

argument_clauses.name: ItemsColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the values to use for hashing
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the values to use for hashing

argument_clauses.name: HashNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of hash functions to generate. The hash.num determines the number and size of clusters generated.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of hash functions to generate. The number_of_hash_functions determines the number and size of clusters generated.

argument_clauses.name: KeyGroups
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of key groups to generate. The number_of_keygroups must be a divisor of number_of_hash_functions. A large number_of_keygroups decreases the probability that multiple users will be assigned to the same cluster identifier.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of key groups to generate. The number_of_keygroups must be a divisor of number_of_hash_functions. A large number_of_keygroups decreases the probability that multiple users will be assigned to the same cluster identifier.

argument_clauses.name: InputFormat
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the format of the values to be hashed (the values in items_column).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the format of the values to be hashed (the values in items_column).

argument_clauses.name: MinClusterSize
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the minimum cluster size. The default value is 3.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the minimum cluster size. The default value is 3.

argument_clauses.name: MaxClusterSize
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum cluster size. The default value is 5.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum cluster size. The default value is 5.

argument_clauses.name: Delimiter
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the delimiter used between hashed values (typically customer identifiers) in the output. The default value is the space character.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the delimiter used between hashed values (typically customer identifiers) in the output. The default value is the space character.
